result.execSummary:
The defendant Cyrus C Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cyrus C Hunter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWO YEARS, with credit for 65 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is ONE  YEAR.  

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
1) Take all prescribed medications
2) Defendant referred to the Mental Health Unit 
3) Court set restitution at zero
4) Pay all mandatory  costs and surcharges from prison wages up to 25% DOC shall collect the sums,  if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.


Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Cyrus C Hunter in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Cyrus C Hunter in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED AND READ IN .

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Cyrus C Hunter not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: PICK N SAVE - N. 35TH ST; BYRON C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cyrus C Hunter in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Cyrus C Hunter in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
